before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"8l3g1","text":"Planning","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ut35","text":"This protocol requires the use of a Biological Safety Laboratory level S2 due to handling of human substrates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a7ak0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1nlv7","text":"This protocol takes ~1 day.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"59lr9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"csnet","text":"Prepare a cool tube-rack for 1.5ml and 2ml tubes by placing it at +4°C for the DNA-clean up. This will speed up reaction time with a 'cold start'.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"tdnn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8d2ak","text":"Modern dental plaque samples should be stored at least at +4°C or preferably at -20°C to preserved DNA after sampling.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b7e15","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a372t","text":"Check waste disposal guidance for all reagents in this protocol against your corresponding laboratory regulations.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1h4so","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"efcg9","text":"Equipment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cgkad","text":"Make sure all necessary equipment is available (see Materials).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o82h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fs04o","text":"Abbreviations","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cuggp","text":"HPLC = High Performance Liquid Chromatography (i.e., HPLC-grade water)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b6mba","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"baait","text":"Controls","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64sof","text":"Consider taking along a positive control (sample of known performance) and a negative control (tube with HLPC-grade water instead of DNA) in order to assess the performance of the protocol and the level of background contamination. Take into account these two extra samples in your calculations for buffer preparations. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

creator.name: Irina Velsko

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"eupjv","text":"Protocol for DNA extraction from modern dental plaque dried on gauze samples for Illumina sequencing. This protocol uses the Qiagen PowerSoil DNA extraction kit, but applies modifications to improve DNA recovery. Specifically, solution C2 is not used to avoid uneccessary DNA loss during inhibitor removal. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

fork_info.title: DNA Extraction from Modern Dental Calculus

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"49njs","text":"Definitions","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"75hua","text":"Stock-aliquot refers to a personal 'stock' (e.g. in a 50ml Falcon Tube) of reagents you can use across multiple sessions of this protocol. An 'aliquot' refers to a sub-aliquot of the stock, that is used for a single session of this specific protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"e04cu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"br9r2","text":"Protocol Specific Guidelines","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"detm7","text":"This protocol requires the use of a Biological Safety Laboratory level S2 due to handling of human substrates.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dimd4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"cblh6","text":"Place a 1.5ml/2ml tube rack at   for the incubation steps on the final days","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":[]},{"key":"bfal1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F8A083E03A1711EB9FB18131F635C93A","id":"38665","label":"","temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3v3rg","text":"Label for each sample one 2ml-Eppendorf Safe-Lock DNA LoBind-Tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1dhgp","text":" and one 1.5ml-Eppendorf Safe-Lock DNA LoBind-Tube ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3arai","text":"Retrieve the spin filter columns (provided in the kit) from fridge to warm them up to   for use at step 25","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fdka8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"44h49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"4D167AF0EFEC11E9B9AC2549EE12AF05","id":"38669","label":"","temperature":"-20","unit":32}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"cfkjb","text":"\"provided in the kit\" refers to: DNeasy PowerSoil Kit (100) Cat No./ID: 12888-100","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"d4iin","text":"A spin filter column is a spin filter unit sitting in a collection column. The spin filter unit contains the       membrane.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6p4vc","text":"Label for each sample one Power Bead tube, one spin filter column and three 2ml collection tubes (all provided in the kit).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvp41","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1rjud","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"40p48","text":"Be sure to label both the top and sides of the PowerSoil bead tube. The labeling on the top may be rubbed off during bead-beating with the Omni BeadRuptor. ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d47nu","text":"Invert the PowerSoil bead tubes to mix and fully submerge gauze with plaque. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
